properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 2:36PM MST until January 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW THIS WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...

.Snow will begin across east-central Oregon and the mountains
of west-central Idaho tonight as the first in a series of low
pressure systems impacts the region. The mountains will see
periods of heavy snow through at least Tuesday as three separate
storm systems track through the Pacific Northwest. Valleys will
see periods of snow through Tuesday with accumulating snow
becoming more likely into early next week.

* WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, tonight and
Saturday, snow accumulations up to 3 inches, except up to 5
inches over the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.
For the second advisory, late Saturday night through Sunday
night, snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except up to 9
inches in the mountains. For the Winter Storm Watch Tuesday,
snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible.

* WHERE...Southwest Highlands and Owyhee Mountains zones.

* WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, late tonight
through saturday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory,
late Saturday night through Sunday night. The Winter Storm
Watch will be for Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SATURDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TO 6 AM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON
